fields.value: Replication Data for: Worth Weighting? How to Think About and Use Weights in Survey Experiments

dsDescriptionValue.value: Replication materials for the forthcoming publication entitled "Worth Weighting? How to Think About and Use Weights in Survey Experiments."

files.description: contains .bib reference for these replication materials.
files.label: DOI-10.7910-DVN_52UGJT.bib

dataFile.description: contains .bib reference for these replication materials.

files.description: contains wrapper code for running one analysis on a given experiment.
files.label: _function_analysis.R

dataFile.description: contains wrapper code for running one analysis on a given experiment.

files.description: contains labels for experiment names and subsets for analysis (this is basically a datafile)
files.label: _paper_analysis_labels.R

dataFile.description: contains labels for experiment names and subsets for analysis (this is basically a datafile)

files.description: This file contains code to visualize the output from the prior files, producing the results presented in Section 6 of "Worth Weighting?" This code requires all of the saved output from both "`run_paper_data_analysis.R`" and "`run_paper_analysis_noPS.R`". See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.
files.label: run_paper_data_analysis_figures.R

dataFile.description: This file contains code to visualize the output from the prior files, producing the results presented in Section 6 of "Worth Weighting?" This code requires all of the saved output from both "`run_paper_data_analysis.R`" and "`run_paper_analysis_noPS.R`". See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.

files.description: This file is a version of the "run_paper_data_analysis.R", except it does not post-stratify on party ID. See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.
files.label: run_paper_data_analysis_noPS.R

dataFile.description: This file is a version of the "run_paper_data_analysis.R", except it does not post-stratify on party ID. See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.

files.description: This file contains code to generate the analyses that are presented in Section 6 of "Worth Weighting? How to Think About and Use Sample Weights in Survey Experiments".  It will generate a series of output files for the analyzed experiments. See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.
files.label: run_paper_data_analysis.R

dataFile.description: This file contains code to generate the analyses that are presented in Section 6 of "Worth Weighting? How to Think About and Use Sample Weights in Survey Experiments".  It will generate a series of output files for the analyzed experiments. See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.

files.description: This file contains code to run the simulations presented in Section 5 of "Worth Weighting? How to Think About and Use Sample Weights in Survey Experiments." See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.
files.label: run_paper_simulations.R

dataFile.description: This file contains code to run the simulations presented in Section 5 of "Worth Weighting? How to Think About and Use Sample Weights in Survey Experiments." See the _Usage_ section of README.pdf for instructions on running this as well as approximate runtimes.

files.description: contains functions to run and analyze the simulation.
files.label: _simulation_functions.R

dataFile.description: contains functions to run and analyze the simulation.

files.description: This file contains the raw survey experiment data. It is used by "`run_paper_data_analysis.R`" and "`run_paper_data_analysis_noPS.R`"
files.label: Survey_Experiment_Data.Rda

dataFile.description: This file contains the raw survey experiment data. It is used by "`run_paper_data_analysis.R`" and "`run_paper_data_analysis_noPS.R`"
